_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

A.     Introduction

SEK Coop-Fredonia. is a supplier of fertilizer, agrichemical, seed and other inputs to farmers. Bulk and packaged products are received via transport trucks and stored for the eventual sale to farmers. This facility has an good safety record with only one injury and no deaths to plant personnel or contractors within the previous 5 year time frame.  



B.     Accidental Release Prevention Policies and Program

This facility strives to meet or exceed compliance with state anhydrous ammonia regulations. Training is provided for each new hire and re-hire employee and also and every three years as required by OSHA. The anhydrous ammonia tank(s) and associated equipment are inspected following recommended industry and engineering frequencies. 



C.    Emergency Response Policies and Programs



Each employee is trained to be familiar with the emergency action policies and procedures through safety reviews and other safety meetings. This facility has an Emergency Plan which covers accidental releases, natural disasters, security incidents and other emergency practices and procedures. The Emergency Plan for this facility is reviewed annually and updated on an as needed basis as part of a comprehensive review process. The Emergency Plan for this facility includes specific instructions for the employees regarding the response procedures to an emergency. The procedures provided in the Emergency Plan are shared with all employees and followed in the event of an emergency. The local emergency planning committee and fire department personnel are furnished a copy of the Emergency Plan for this facility and invited for a tour on a regular basis.



D.    Worse-Case Scenario/Alternative-Case Scenario



This facility has developed a worse-case and an alternative-case scenario however it has been withheld from this Executive Summary as security-sensitive information as requested by EPA.



E.    Five Year Accident History



This facility has had one ac

cident as a result of a failure of a water tank used to bleed off ammonia.  The aqueous solution splashed an employee and resulted in chemical burns.  All reportable incidents have been reported to the proper authorities.  The release of anhydrous ammonia was extremely minimal.



F.    Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Management of this company and facility continuously look for ways to enhance the safety of this location. Annual equipment inspections are also conducted, and detailed environmental health and safety audits are conducted at least every three years.



G.    Summary



The employees of this company are proud of our safety record and vast improvements made in both environmental stewardship and safety. We believe with our enhanced programs and policies in place and with the continued efforts of our personnel, we will improve our safety record and our facility's environment for the public, our customers and our employees for years to come.
